channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14144] Bloomfilter path to work with Byte buffered cells
item.description: This JIRA is to check if there will be a need to make the bloom filters to work with ByteBuffer cells. During POC this path created lot of duplicated code but considering other refactorings done in this path may lead to less duplication. This JIRA is a placeholder.
item.summary: Bloomfilter path to work with Byte buffered cells

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Patch to make use of BB cells. The final place where we do the contains() check in BloomFilter uses the byte[] only by copying the key part of the cell to byte[]. Currently Hash algo works with the key byte[] only. So better not to change that now.
This patch avoid unnecessary copies that happens due to the creation of KV in the read path except for the final copy to form the key.

These names are getting a little crazy:

FirstOnRowByteBufferedFakeCell

... and here: FirstOnRowFakeCell

Then we have FirstOnRowColByteBufferedFakeCell but later we write out 'Col' in full: FirstOnRowColumnFakeCell (perhaps use 'Col' because that is method name)

We have this FakeByteBufferedCell, then this FirstOnRowByteBufferedFakeCell (Why position of 'Fake' moved?)

What is 'fake' about the Cell?

Otherwise, patch looking good.

Updated patch. Changes all the fake cells with 'column' to 'col'. The ByteBufferedCell is changed to BBCell to make it small.
The term fake represents that we try to create the first on row or last on row type of Cells using the existing cell's components. Previously these type of Kvs where created by copying the contents every time and now as we are having the concept of cell such copies are not required. Anyway these things are just used for doing sort of seek and reseeks and they are not going to be returned to the clients.

FirstOnRowBBFakeCell
Need to override getRowArray also as the super class returns empty byte[]. We can use CellUtil clone API

FirstOnRowColBBFakeCell
Same way override getQualifierArray


            Cell kvKey = KeyValueUtil.createFirstOnRow(row, 0, row.length, 

1252	              HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY, 0, 0, column, 0,

1253	              column.length);

1254	            return passesGeneralRowColBloomFilter(kvKey);

Here we are creating a KV by copy and later down in checkGeneralBloomFilter(byte[] key, Cell kvKey, BloomFilter bloomFilter) we again create
Cell rowBloomKey = CellUtil.createFirstOnRow(kvKey);
Can we avoid? Some sort of refactoring may be needed. Any chance to use CellUtil instead of KeyValueUtil and avoid a copy?

We may have to change Hash function to work with BB also? Later in another jira may be

FirstOnRowBBFakeCell -> Better we can name it as FirstOnRowFakeBBCell

Updated patch that adds CloneXXX methods in the FakeBBCell.

Here we are creating a KV by copy and later down in checkGeneralBloomFilter(byte[] key, Cell kvKey, BloomFilter bloomFilter) we again create

Cell rowBloomKey = CellUtil.createFirstOnRow(kvKey);
Can we avoid? Some sort of refactoring may be needed. Any chance to use CellUtil instead of KeyValueUtil and avoid a copy?

The rowBloomKey is needed here for the Deletefamily bloom cases. So the kvKey is a cell created out of row and col and in this rowBloomKey case we only need the row part of the Cell. Also the 


              exists =

                  bloomFilter.contains(kvKey, bloom) ||

                  bloomFilter.contains(rowBloomKey, bloom);

Will expect a Cell and that is why converted the rowBloomKey to a new Cell.

FirstOnRowBBFakeCell -> Better we can name it as FirstOnRowFakeBBCell

Yes changed.

We may have to change Hash function to work with BB also? Later in another jira may be

Ya this needs a bigger change and it is not straight forward. The Hash needs a continuous byte[] to work with. So we need to have the key part of the Cell. If we try to operate as Cell it is going to be difficult with that algo design. So anyway we need to do a copy - better we can have it byte[] for now.

BTW

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

This seems unrelated to the patch.


1 warning

[WARNING] Javadoc Warnings

[WARNING] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/protobuf/ProtobufUtil.java:3147: warning - @param argument "caps" is not a parameter name.

Should be because of this.

The rowBloomKey is needed here for the Deletefamily bloom cases. So the kvKey is a cell created out of row and col and in this rowBloomKey case we only need the row part of the Cell. Also the

Yes. Discussed with Ram here. We can see how we can better do it with out much of the obj creations. For a later issue. Those will be much involved changes in the Bloom area.

FirstOnRowBBFakeCell - Now also all the class names are not consistent. It has to follow naming pattern of ....FakeBBCell. You changed for some.. Pls correct all such places. Can fix on commit. +1 otherwise.

The term fake represents that we try to create the first on row or last on row type of Cells using the existing cell's components.

Understood. The keys are not 'fake' though, right? They are actually 'real' Cells. Since you 'FirstOnRow' in names like FirstOnRowColFakeCell, the 'Fake' seems redundant as a signifier that this key is 'unusual' – 'FirstOnRow' is sufficient (We've already talked up how these compound names need a little pruning).

On ByteBuffered in ByteBufferedCell being shortened to BB, is it going to be ambigious now we have ByteBuff in the mix and do we do BB elsewhere or do we write it out in full when a class is about ByteBuffer?

You mean the 'Fake' is redundant? Okie, I think FirstOnRowCell sounds fine to me anyway it is going to extend FakeCell.
Coming to BB - I think all our cells are Bytebuffered only.There is no ByteBuff. But the point of confusion you mention also seems valid.
Updated patch. Removes the redundant 'Fake' word from the name. Also expands BB as ByteBuffered Cell.

FakeByteBufferedCell is not fake either. It is also real. If it is anything, it is abstract. AbstractByteBufferedCell. Otherwise patch looks good. Naming seems to adhere to a regular pattern now. Fix on commit? +1

FakeByteBufferedCell is not fake either. It is also real. If it is anything, it is abstract. AbstractByteBufferedCell.

IMHO, the components of the cell are real, but the type of the cell is fake. We don't have actual cells with MAX or MIN type. It is not going to be even written to files or returned back as a cell to clients.
If we name it as AbstractBytebufferedcell, then it would mean we need to derive cells out of it, I think? Also we already have a Fakecell backed by byte[]. So 'Fake' term is correct is what I think.

So 'Fake' term is correct is what I think.

From google define:fake


fake1

fāk/Submit

noun

1.

a thing that is not genuine; a forgery or sham.

"the painting was a fake"

synonyms:	forgery, counterfeit, copy, pirate(d) copy, sham, fraud, hoax, imitation, mock-up, dummy, reproduction; More

adjective

1.

not genuine; counterfeit.

"fake designer clothing"

synonyms:	forgery, counterfeit, copy, pirate(d) copy, sham, fraud, hoax, imitation, mock-up, dummy, reproduction; More

verb

1.

forge or counterfeit (something).

"the woman faked her spouse's signature"

synonyms:	forge, counterfeit, falsify, mock up, copy, pirate, reproduce, replicate; More

You already changed all other instances of fake. To be consistent I'd think you undo this one too.

Maybe a better name for this abstract class that is all about returning empty byte buffers is EmptyByteBufferedCell.

. The intention to name it as Fake was based on how the existing docs and comments have been written


Create a fake key that is not greater than the real next key.

Create a fake key/value, so that this scanner only bubbles up to the top

using faked key

Ok I will rename both the Fakecell and FakeBBCell to EmtpyCell and EmtpyByteBufferedCell. Intention was not to argue, just to tell what I felt.

Intention was not to argue, just to tell what I felt.

Didn't think otherwise Ram!

Classes called 'fake' though they have a strong character – i.e. they are the first on the row, or they return empty buffers no matter what – and can be instantiated as actual, non-fake classes seemed off. Comments are not exactly right either in their use of fake but I get the gist and these are less important I'd say.

+1 to commit new renames.

Renames the FakeCell and FakeBBCell to EmptyCell and EmptyByteBufferedCell. This is what I will commit.
Anoop Sam John
You fine with this?

+1.. Just add some comments to these classes that they are not real and used for seek/reseek.. Just in case when some one sees this code later, they should get to know what these cells mean for.. Add on commit pls.

Pushed to master. Thanks for the reviews Stack and Anoop.
Added the comment as suggested on commit.
